properties.areaDesc: Clear Lake/Southern Lake County; Southern Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Western Plumas County/Lassen Park; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Northern Lake County; Burney Basin / Eastern Shasta County; Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 31 at 3:45AM PST by NWS Sacramento CA
properties.description:
Strong high pressure will continue daytime temperatures over
Interior Northern California upwards of 10 to 15 degrees above
average today and Saturday. This changes Sunday as a colder
Pacific storm moves inland. Precipitation threat begins Saturday
night into early Sunday over the Coastal and Shasta mountains. The
bulk of mostly light precipitation occurs Sunday into Sunday
night, and mainly in the foothills and mountains.

This storm will usher in significantly colder air that lingers
into Monday. Breezy to windy conditions also expected Sunday and
continue Monday. High temperatures Sunday are forecast upwards of
25 degrees lower than Saturday at some locations. Low
temperatures Sunday night in the Sacramento Valley will be in the
30s, locally below freezing possible in wind sheltered areas,
with mostly teens and 20s in the foothills and mountains.

Snow levels drop Sunday into the foothills during the afternoon
into evening. Overall snow amounts will be light. Locally upwards
of around 5 inches possible over higher elevations of the Western
Plumas mountains and Northern Sierra Nevada. Local snow
accumulations of an inch are also possible in the higher
elevations of the foothills Sunday afternoon and night. Travel
into the mountains could be slow with possible chain controls.
Those heading into the high country Sunday should check the latest
road conditions prior to departure.

NWSheadline: Breezy And Much Cooler Sunday With Some Light Precipitation
